docs.text: Welcome to MkDocs For full documentation visit mkdocs.org . Commands mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit. Project layout mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: mkdocs安装

docs.text: Skia Lua Bindings Warning: The following has only been tested on Mac and Linux, but it will likely work for any Unix. Prerequisites This assumes you already have Skia building normally. If not, refer to How to build Skia . Build To build Lua support into Skia tools, set the GN argument skia_use_lua to true . Optionally, set skia_use_system_lua . Then re-run GN. Try It Out The tools lua_app and lua_pictures should now be available when you compile, and Viewer should now have a Lua sample. To-Do Skia had a feature that let it be imported as an .so by Lua. This feature is not yet supported by GN, but would have looked something like this: $ lua Lua 5.2.0 Copyright (C) 1994-2011 Lua.org, PUC-Rio > require 'skia' > paint = Sk.newPaint() > paint:setColor{a=1, r=1, g=0, b=0} > doc = Sk.newDocumentPDF('test.pdf') > canvas = doc:beginPage(72*8.5, 72*11) > canvas:drawText('Hello Lua', 300, 300, paint) > doc:close()
docs.title: vscode

docs.text: Warning: The following has only been tested on Mac and Linux, but it will likely work for any Unix.
docs.title: Skia Lua Bindings

docs.text: This assumes you already have Skia building normally. If not, refer to How to build Skia .
docs.title: Prerequisites

docs.text: To build Lua support into Skia tools, set the GN argument skia_use_lua to true . Optionally, set skia_use_system_lua . Then re-run GN.
docs.title: Build

docs.text: The tools lua_app and lua_pictures should now be available when you compile, and Viewer should now have a Lua sample.
docs.title: Try It Out

docs.text: Skia had a feature that let it be imported as an .so by Lua. This feature is not yet supported by GN, but would have looked something like this: $ lua Lua 5.2.0 Copyright (C) 1994-2011 Lua.org, PUC-Rio > require 'skia' > paint = Sk.newPaint() > paint:setColor{a=1, r=1, g=0, b=0} > doc = Sk.newDocumentPDF('test.pdf') > canvas = doc:beginPage(72*8.5, 72*11) > canvas:drawText('Hello Lua', 300, 300, paint) > doc:close()
docs.title: To-Do
